required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single Patient Protocol for an NRG1 Fusion Positive Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer Patient Using Seribantumab
clinical_study.official_title: Single Patient Protocol for an NRG1 Fusion Positive Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer Patient Using Seribantumab

brief_summary.textblock: NRG1 gene fusions are extremely rare across solid tumours (estimate 0.3-0.5%). However, it is felt to be an actionable and potentially major growth pathway for those tumours that harbour this gene rearrangement. Tumours that harbour NRG1 fusions are driven by HER3 overactivation. Seribantumab is a mono-clonal antibody against HER3, it binds HER3 and inhibits NRG1-dependent activation and HER2 dimerization.

arm_group.description: For the induction phase: Seribantumab 3,000 mg IV weekly for 12 weeks then Maintenance Phase: Seribantumab 3,000 mg IV infusion once every 2 weeks, initiating approximately 14 days after completion of induction phase. Dose or schedule may be adjusted at the discretion of the treating physician.

intervention.description: For the induction phase: Seribantumab 3,000 mg IV weekly for 12 weeks then Maintenance Phase: Seribantumab 3,000 mg IV infusion once every 2 weeks, initiating approximately 14 days after completion of induction phase. Dose or schedule may be adjusted at the discretion of the treating physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Serious, life-threatening condition
- Not eligible for, or exhausted all other treatment options or causing significant toxicity
- No other way to access treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
-
